page.title: 12Transport in Landscove
page.content: The iron rings still in evidence on the school wall tell us that children once rode their{ponies}to the school.Those would be the lucky children most would have to{walk}some coming two or three miles along muddy tracks and lanes to get here. Mr.Warren remembers that most farmers had ponies and 'traps' for their personal transport in the twenties and most went into Totnes or Ashburton for special business and cars were seldom seen,just one or two in the towns.There was a station a Staverton which also was served by 4{trains daily to Buckfastleigh,Totnes,and Plymouth.Many Landscove people used the train for pleasure trips as well as business.After the war better pay meant more people bought{cars}and the railway was used less ,fewer trains ran ,finally the line closed .
